abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Policy Reform
            Support Loan (PRSL) Project is to advance the alternance
            Government's broad-based economic and social reform
            program, which aims to accelerate Gross Domestic Product and
            employment growth, and to increase access to basic services
            and reduce poverty. The Government will pursue sound
            macroeconomic management, initiate public sector reform,
            encourage private sector development, and address the
            country's social development agenda. The benefits of
            the reform will enhance Morocco's competitiveness and
            achieve strong, sustainable growth, while advancing the
            country's important social development agenda.
            Moreover, the preparation of the loan has served to promote
            a dialogue and develop a partnership with the alternance
            Government, and act as a catalyst in setting out a
            medium-term framework for reform in Morocco. The project
            risks include: potential disruption of the authorities'
            medium-term growth forecasts, potential political opposition
            to reforms; technical implementation difficulties; and
            potential social problems. These risks will be mitigated by
            the government's effort to pursue budgetary adjustment
            and improve business environment as well as climate for
            private investment; a close policy dialogue with the
            Government and stakeholders; and a technical dialogue with
            all government agencies concerned.
